verses.kjv: Righteous art thou, O LORD, when I plead with thee: yet let me talk with thee of thy judgments: Wherefore doth the way of the wicked prosper? wherefore are all they happy that deal very treacherously?
verses.ct: You are always right, LORD, when I bring my case to you. Still, let me raise a question about your justice: Why do wicked people succeed? Why do those who are completely dishonest live without worry?

verses.kjv: Thou hast planted them, yea, they have taken root: they grow, yea, they bring forth fruit: thou art near in their mouth, and far from their reins.
verses.ct: You planted them, and they took root. They thrive and even produce fruit. Your name is always on their lips, but their hearts are far from you.

verses.kjv: But thou, O LORD, knowest me: thou hast seen me, and tried mine heart toward thee: pull them out like sheep for the slaughter, and prepare them for the day of slaughter.
verses.ct: But you know me, LORD. You see me and have tested my devotion to you. Drag them away like sheep headed for slaughter, and set them apart for the day of killing.

verses.kjv: How long shall the land mourn, and the herbs of every field wither, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein? the beasts are consumed, and the birds; because they said, He shall not see our last end.
verses.ct: How long will the land grieve, and the vegetation in every field dry up because of the evil of those who live in it? The animals and birds have perished because the people said, 'God won't see what happens to us in the end.'

verses.kjv: If thou hast run with the footmen, and they have wearied thee, then how canst thou contend with horses? and if in the land of peace, wherein thou trustedst, they wearied thee, then how wilt thou do in the swelling of Jordan?
verses.ct: "If running against ordinary men has worn you out, how will you compete against horses? If you stumble in safe, open country, what will you do in the thick brush along the Jordan?"

verses.kjv: For even thy brethren, and the house of thy father, even they have dealt treacherously with thee; yea, they have called a multitude after thee: believe them not, though they speak fair words unto thee.
verses.ct: "Even your own brothers and your father's family have betrayed you. They have rallied others against you. Don't trust them, even when they say kind things to you."

verses.kjv: I have forsaken mine house, I have left mine heritage; I have given the dearly beloved of my soul into the hand of her enemies.
verses.ct: "I have abandoned my house and left my inheritance. I have handed over the people I deeply love to their enemies.

verses.kjv: Mine heritage is unto me as a lion in the forest; it crieth out against me: therefore have I hated it.
verses.ct: My inheritance has turned on me like a lion in the forest, roaring against me. That is why I have rejected it.

verses.kjv: Mine heritage is unto me as a speckled bird, the birds round about are against her; come ye, assemble all the beasts of the field, come to devour.
verses.ct: My inheritance is like a speckled bird of prey, with other birds circling to attack it. Come, gather all the wild animals — come and devour!

verses.kjv: Many pastors have destroyed my vineyard, they have trodden my portion under foot, they have made my pleasant portion a desolate wilderness.
verses.ct: Many rulers have ruined my vineyard. They have trampled my land and turned my beautiful territory into an empty wasteland.

verses.kjv: They have made it desolate, and being desolate it mourneth unto me; the whole land is made desolate, because no man layeth it to heart.
verses.ct: They have left it desolate, and in its desolation it cries out to me. The entire land is devastated because no one takes it to heart.

verses.kjv: The spoilers are come upon all high places through the wilderness: for the sword of the LORD shall devour from the one end of the land even to the other end of the land: no flesh shall have peace.
verses.ct: Destroyers have swept across every barren hilltop in the wilderness, because the sword of the LORD consumes from one end of the land to the other. No living person will find peace.

verses.kjv: They have sown wheat, but shall reap thorns: they have put themselves to pain, but shall not profit: and they shall be ashamed of your revenues because of the fierce anger of the LORD.
verses.ct: They planted wheat but harvested thorns. They exhausted themselves but gained nothing. Their crops will bring them shame because of the fierce anger of the LORD."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD against all mine evil neighbours, that touch the inheritance which I have caused my people Israel to inherit; Behold, I will pluck them out of their land, and pluck out the house of Judah from among them.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says about all the hostile neighbors who have seized the inheritance he gave to his people Israel: "Pay attention — I will uproot them from their land, and I will pull the people of Judah out from among them.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, after that I have plucked them out I will return, and have compassion on them, and will bring them again, every man to his heritage, and every man to his land.
verses.ct: But after I have uprooted them, I will turn back and show them compassion. I will bring each nation back to its own inheritance and its own land.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, if they will diligently learn the ways of my people, to swear by my name, The LORD liveth; as they taught my people to swear by Baal; then shall they be built in the midst of my people.
verses.ct: If they truly learn the ways of my people and take their oaths in my name, saying 'As surely as the LORD lives' — just as they once taught my people to swear by Baal — then they will be established among my people.

verses.kjv: But if they will not obey, I will utterly pluck up and destroy that nation, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: But if any nation refuses to listen, I will completely uproot and destroy it," declares the LORD.
